incidents.wikitext: The [[Sevastopol Naval Base|headquarters]] of the [[Black Sea Fleet]] in [[Sevastopol]], [[Crimea]], is hit in a [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] missile attack, killing at least one person and causing a fire in the building. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/9/22/black-sea-navy-hq-hit-in-crimea-missile-attack-one-dead-russia (Al Jazeera)]

Two people are killed and five others are wounded in a [[Mortar (weapon)|mortar]] attack on [[Timbuktu]], [[Mali]], by [[jihadism|jihadist]] insurgents. The city remains under [[siege]] by insurgents with reports of food, petrol and medicine [[shortage]]s. [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-66887546 (BBC News)]

At least 20 people are killed in a [[Suicide attack|suicide]] [[car bomb]]ing at a [[security checkpoint|checkpoint]] in [[Beledweyne]], [[Hiran, Somalia|Hiran]], [[Somalia]]. [https://english.news.cn/20230923/204a1b98d1594da188c406e95b9b8662/c.html (Xinhua)]

[[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon|UNIFIL]] intervenes to prevent a confrontation between the [[Lebanese Army]] and the [[Israeli Army]] near the [[Shebaa Farms]]. [https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-760236 (''The Jerusalem Post'')]

One [[Kosovo Police]] officer is killed and another is injured during an [[ambush]] on their patrol in [[North Kosovo]], near the border with [[Serbia]], after around 30 gunmen storm a village. Three of the attackers are later killed in a [[shootout]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/9/24/one-police-officer-killed-in-kosovo-attack-blamed-on-serbia (Al Jazeera)]

[[President of France|French President]] [[Emmanuel Macron]] announces that [[France]] will end [[French Armed Forces|its military]] presence in [[Niger]] and will remove its ambassador from the country following a deterioration  in [[France–Niger relations|relations]]. [https://apnews.com/article/france-niger-military-ambassador-coup-0e866135cd49849ba4eb4426346bffd5 (AP)]

The government of [[Republic of Artsakh|Artsakh]] says that most of its population will leave following [[Azerbaijan]]'s takeover of the territory with [[Armenia]] confirming that 1,050 [[refugee]]s from Artsakh have arrived in the country. [https://www.reuters.com/world/armenia-calls-un-mission-monitor-rights-nagorno-karabakh-2023-09-24/ (Reuters)]

Authorities in [[Iran]] disarm 30 [[Improvised explosive device|explosive devices]] that were set to [[detonate]] simultaneously in [[Tehran]] and arrest 28 people linked to the [[Islamic State]]. [https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2023/09/24/Iran-says-it-defused-30-bombs-in-Tehran-detained-28-ISIS-linked-terrorists- (Al Arabiya)]

Two [[Palestinians]] are killed when [[Israeli Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]] storm a [[Palestinian refugee camps|refugee camp]] in [[Tulkarem]], in the occupied [[West Bank]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/9/24/israel-kills-two-palestinians-amid-surge-in-military-raids (Al Jazeera)]

[[Kosovo Police]] enter the village of [[Banjska (village)|Banjska]], [[North Kosovo]], with [[armored vehicle]]s, a day after the village was attacked by gunmen. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/kosovo-police-enter-northern-village-after-shootout-with-gunmen-killed-four-2023-09-25/ (Reuters)]

The number of [[refugee]]s that have fled to [[Armenia]] from [[Republic of Artsakh|Artsakh]] increases to 6,500, while a further 700 are sheltering with Russian peacekeepers.[https://apnews.com/article/armenia-azerbaijan-nagorno-karabakh-turkey-erdogan-refugees-275856efde7cb8f9a82d505bd36edf17 (AP)]
[[Ukraine]] receives its first shipment of [[M1 Abrams]] tanks from the [[United States]]. [https://www.rferl.org/a/ukraine-odesa-russia-strikes/32608092.html (RFE/RL)]

An [[ambush]] by [[Houthi]] [[insurgent]]s kills two [[Bahraini soldier]]s, including an officer, and injures several others. [https://apnews.com/article/bahrain-saudi-yemen-rebel-attack-bd34cd645c3319d904ddab1857386f02 (AP)]

Twenty-one gunmen, four [[Syrian Democratic Forces|SDF]] members, and a [[civilian]] are killed following the resumption of clashes in [[Deir ez-Zor Governorate|Deir ez-Zor]], [[Syria]]. [https://www.syriahr.com/en/311931/ (SOHR)]

The number of [[refugee]]s fleeing from [[Republic of Artsakh|Artsakh]] to [[Armenia]] increases to 50,243, more than a third of the region's population. [https://www.france24.com/en/europe/20230927-tens-of-thousands-of-refugees-flee-nagorno-karabakh-for-armenia (France 24)]

Former [[State Minister of Artsakh]] [[Ruben Vardanyan (politician)|Ruben Vardanyan]] is arrested by [[Azerbaijan]] after attempting to cross the border into Armenia. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-66934776 (BBC News)]

[[Azerbaijan]] reports that 192 of [[Azerbaijani Armed Forces|its troops]] were killed and more than 500 others were injured during last week's [[offensive (military)|offensive]] in [[Nagorno-Karabakh]]. [https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/azerbaijan-192-troops-killed-weeks-offensive-nagorno-karabakh-103519537 (ABC News)]

Authorities in the [[Mexican state]] of [[Nuevo León]] find at least twelve bodies dumped on roads near [[Monterrey]], likely related to a [[drug cartel]] operating in [[Tamaulipas]]. [https://www.cbsnews.com/amp/news/corpses-body-parts-found-monterrey-mexico/ (CBS News)]

[[Samvel Shahramanyan]], [[President of Artsakh|president]] of the breakaway [[Republic of Artsakh]], signs a decree to dissolve all state [[Government of Artsakh|institutions of Artsakh]] in 2024. [https://edition.cnn.com/2023/09/28/europe/nagorno-karabakh-officially-dissolve-intl/index.html (CNN)]

The [[Patriotic Movement for Safeguard and Restoration|ruling]] [[September 2022 Burkina Faso coup d'état|military government]] of [[Burkina Faso]] arrests four officers suspected of attempting to stage a [[coup]]. Two additional officers are on the run. [https://www.cnn.com/2023/09/28/africa/burkina-faso-foiled-coup-attempt-intl/index.html (CNN)]

More than 80 people are injured during [[riot]]s that occurred during [[protest]]s over the [[murder in Indian law|murder]] of two [[Meitei people|Meitei]] students in [[Manipur]], [[India]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/9/28/curfew-in-parts-of-indias-manipur-after-protests-over-killing-of-students (Al Jazeera)]

[[Jihadism|Jihadist]] [[insurgent]]s kill at least ten [[Niger Armed Forces|Nigerien soldiers]] in Kandadji, [[Tillabéri Region]], [[Niger]]. Seven soldiers are later killed and five others are injured in a vehicle accident while travelling to reinforce the army unit under attack. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/least-ten-niger-soldiers-killed-militant-attack-2023-09-28/ (Reuters)]

Six teenagers who were [[kidnap]]ped by a group of armed men a few days ago are found dead near [[Villanueva, Zacatecas|Villanueva]], [[Zacatecas]], [[Mexico]]. [https://english.elpais.com/international/2023-09-28/six-bodies-and-one-survivor-found-in-search-for-kidnapped-teens-in-zacatecas-mexico.html?outputType=amp (''El País'')]

Five people are killed and ten others are injured by two suicide bombers at a [[mosque]] in [[Hangu, Pakistan|Hangu]], [[Khyber Pakhtunkhwa]], Pakistan. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/9/29/several-killed-as-another-blast-hits-pakistan-on-prophets-birthday (Al Jazeera)]

Four [[Pakistan Army|soldiers]] and three [[Pakistani Taliban]] militants are killed during a [[shootout]] in [[Zhob]], Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. [https://www.aajenglish.tv/news/30335287/four-soldiers-martyred-in-fire-exchange-with-terrorists-in-zhob (Aaj English Tv)]

At least 50 people are killed and more than 50 others are injured in a [[Suicide attack|suicide bombing]] at a [[religious gathering]] in [[Mastung, Pakistan|Mastung]], [[Balochistan, Pakistan|Balochistan]], [[Pakistan]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-66956626 (BBC News)]

At least five people are killed and 18 others are injured when an [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|al-Shabaab]] suicide bomber [[detonate]]s his [[explosive belt]] in a tea shop in [[Mogadishu]], [[Somalia]]. [https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/suicide-bomber-kills-7-somali-tea-shop-2023-09-29/ (Reuters)]

Five [[Free Papua Movement]] militants are killed during a [[shootout]] with [[Indonesian Army|Indonesian soldiers]] and [[Indonesian National Police|police officers]] in the [[Papua (province)|Papua province]]. [https://apnews.com/article/indonesia-rebels-killed-papua-clash-cf782b546baae8533ab40d6e680c4755 (AP)]

[[Azerbaijan]] accuses [[Armenia]] of using a [[sniper]] to kill one of [[Azerbaijani Armed Forces|its soldiers]] in the city of [[Kalbajar]]. Armenia denies involvement in the incident. [https://www.thestar.com.my/news/world/2023/09/30/azerbaijan-says-serviceman-killed-by-sniper-armenia-denies-incident (''The Star'')]

Two [[Morena (political party)|Morena party]] pollsters are killed and a third is kidnapped in [[Juárez, Chiapas]], [[Mexico]]. A note was left on the bodies from the [[Jalisco New Generation Cartel]], threatening [[Federal government of Mexico|the government]]. [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/pollsters-killed-kidnapped-mexico-cartel-sign-reportedly-left-with-victims/ (CBS News)]

A [[Suicide attack|suicide bomber]] blew himself up outside the [[Ministry of the Interior (Turkey)|Interior Ministry]] in [[Ankara]], [[Turkey]], injuring two [[General Directorate of Security (Turkey)|police]] officers. A second attacker is shot dead by police. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/1/explosion-and-gunfire-reported-in-turkish-capital (Al Jazeera)]

[[National Movement for the Liberation of Azawad|Tuareg rebels]] take control of the town of [[Bamba, Gao Region|Bamba]], [[Gao Region]], [[Mali]], claiming over 80 [[Malian Armed Forces|soldiers]] have been killed. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-66976440 (BBC News)]

At least 29 [[Niger Armed Forces|soldiers]] are killed during an [[ambush]] by [[Islamic extremism|Islamic extremists]] in the [[Tahoua Region]], [[Niger]], involving [[Suicide attack|suicide]] [[car bomb]]s and [[Improvised explosive device|bombings]]. Several attackers are killed in a [[counter-offensive]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-66991696 (BBC News)]

[[Turkey]] launches [[airstrike]]s against around 20 [[Kurdistan Workers' Party|PKK]] targets in northern [[Iraq]], in response to the [[2023 Ankara bombing|PKK's bombing]] of [[Ankara]], killing an unknown number of militants. [https://apnews.com/article/turkey-ankara-explosion-dfdbae1c7cd90f7e0a48b029c866b561 (AP)]

[[Ukraine]] says that [[Russia]] has attacked a store and cafe in [[Hroza, Kharkiv Oblast|Hroza]], [[Kharkiv Oblast]], with a [[ballistic missile]], killing at least 51 [[civilian]]s. [https://apnews.com/article/russia-ukraine-war-zelenskyy-travel-drone-attacks-f7c320ed2908b447f32bf32ede8caf2f (AP)]

Russia says that a child has been killed and three others are injured while trying to dismantle [[cluster munition]]s fired from Ukrainian forces, in the [[Russian-occupied territories of Ukraine|occupied]] city of [[Horlivka]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/10/5/russia-ukraine-war-live-kyiv-says-24-drones-launched-by-moscow-downed (Al Jazeera)]

The [[United States]] transfers 1.1 million rounds of [[Iran]]ian [[ammunition]] to Ukraine after the [[United States Navy|U.S. Navy]] [[Civil forfeiture in the United States|seized]] them from a shipment enroute to [[Yemen]] in December. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-67014218 (BBC News)]

[[Chancellor of Germany|German Chancellor]] [[Olaf Scholz]] pledges a second [[MIM-104 Patriot|Patriot air defense system]] to Ukraine. [https://www.spiegel.de/politik/ukraine-krieg-scholz-sagt-kiew-lieferung-von-weiterem-patriot-system-zu-a-a7d75ab1-a328-4391-83f5-4eeb9e549be3 (Spiegel)]

Russia announces the successful test of the [[9M730 Burevestnik|Burevestnik]], a nuclear-powered and nuclear-capable [[cruise missile]] with a potential range of thousands of miles. [https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/putin-says-russia-has-tested-next-generation-nuclear-weapon-2023-10-05/ (Reuters)]

At least 112 troops and civilians are killed and 120 others are injured in a [[Drone warfare|drone attack]] on a [[Syrian Armed Forces|Syrian military]] [[graduation]] ceremony in [[Homs]], [[Syria]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/5/syrian-military-college-hit-in-drone-attack (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.syriahr.com/%d8%a7%d8%b1%d8%aa%d9%81%d8%a7%d8%b9-%d8%ad%d8%b5%d9%8a%d9%84%d8%a9-%d8%aa%d9%81%d8%ac%d9%8a%d8%b1-%d8%a7%d9%84%d9%83%d9%84%d9%8a%d8%a9-%d8%a7%d9%84%d8%ad%d8%b1%d8%a8%d9%8a%d8%a9-%d9%81%d9%8a-%d8%ad/681946/ (SOHR)]

A [[Turkish Air Force]] [[Baykar Bayraktar family|Bayraktar drone]] is shot down by an [[Combined Joint Task Force – Operation Inherent Resolve|international coalition]] [[General Dynamics F-16 Fighting Falcon|F-16 Fighting Falcon]] in [[Al-Hasakah Governorate|Al-Hasakah]], Syria, after reportedly operating too close to [[United States Armed Forces|U.S. forces]] in the vicinity. [https://www.syriahr.com/en/312858/ (SOHR)] [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-drone-shot-turkey-syria-b2424841.html (''The Independent'')]

[[Turkey]] launches a series of [[airstrike]]s targeting the [[Syrian Democratic Forces]] in [[northeastern Syria]], killing at least two people and injuring three others. [https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/middle-east/levant-turkey/1696494319-turkish-airstrikes-in-syria-target-kurdish-areas-killing-2-people (i24 News)]

At least six people are killed and 38 others are injured during a series of airstrikes by the [[Syrian Air Force]] on [[Idlib]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/10/5/syria-live-news-dozens-killed-in-drone-attack-on-military-college (Al Jazeera)]

Four [[Palestinians]] are killed in separate incidents in the occupied [[West Bank]], three by [[Israel Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]], and one by an [[Israeli settler]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/5/israeli-troops-kill-two-palestinians-in-occupied-west-bank-clash (Al Jazeera)]

Two [[Turkish Land Forces|Turkish soldiers]] are [[Turkish Armed Forces casualties in Syria|killed]] when the [[Syrian Army]] fires on their positions with [[artillery]] in northern [[Syria]]. [https://www.syriahr.com/en/313032/ (SOHR)]

A 19-year-old [[Palestinians|Palestinian]] man is shot and killed by [[Israeli settlement|Israeli settlers]] attacking the city of [[Huwara]], [[State of Palestine|Palestine]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/6/palestinian-killed-as-israeli-settlers-attack-west-bank-town-of-huwara (Al Jazeera)]

[[Palestinians|Palestinian]] [[Palestinian political violence|militant group]]s led by [[Hamas]] launch over [[Palestinian rocket attacks on Israel|3,500 rockets]] from the [[Gaza Strip]] into [[Israel]] and execute a surprise [[invasion]] by land, sea and air, breaking through the [[Gaza-Israel barrier]] to attack at least 22 locations in Israel's [[Southern District (Israel)|Southern District]]. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog-october-7-2023/ (Times of Israel)][https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-gaza-hamas-rockets-airstrikes-tel-aviv-11fb98655c256d54ecb5329284fc37d2 (AP)] [https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/conflict-between-israel-palestinians-gaza-2023-10-07/ (Reuters)] [https://www.memri.org/reports/hamas-islamic-jihad-lions-den-threaten-lone-wolf-attacks-claim-capture-israeli-soldiers-call (Memri)]

[[Yonatan Steinberg]], commander of the [[Nahal Brigade|933rd "Nahal" Brigade]], is killed during clashes with Hamas in [[Kerem Shalom]]. [https://theatlasnews.co/brief/2023/10/07/idf-nahel-brigade-colonel-yonatan-steinberg-killed-in-clash-near-kerem-shalom/ (''The Atlas News'')]

Attackers briefly seize control of the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]]'s [[Gaza Division|143rd "Gaza" Division]] [[headquarters]] in [[Re'im]], [[Eshkol Regional Council]], before it is retaken. Several [[Israel|Israeli]] soldiers are captured and taken [[hostage]] to the [[Gaza Strip]]. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-regains-control-of-reim-military-base-from-hamas-terrorists-in-southern-israel/ (''The Times of Israel'')]

[[Battle of Sderot]]: At least twenty [[Israel Police|Israeli police]] officers are killed by Hamas inside the police headquarters of [[Sderot]] after the building is seized. [https://www.jewishpress.com/news/eye-on-palestine/hamas/100-dead-1000-injured-50-kidnapped-as-hamas-invades-southern-israel/2023/10/07/ (Jewish Press)]

The [[Re'im music festival massacre]] is reported. Hundreds are injured, and some survivors are taken as [[hostage]]s. [[Atrocity crime|Atrocities]] are reported in other locations: [[Netiv HaAsara attack]], [[Kfar Aza massacre]], [[Holit massacre]], [[Nir Oz massacre]] and the [[Be'eri massacre]] which is discovered after 50 Israeli [[hostage]]s are rescued by IDF forces. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/at-least-100-killed-on-kibbutz-beeri-alone-emergency-group/ (Times of Israel)][https://www.nytimes.com/2023/10/10/world/middleeast/israel-gaza-war-hamas-deaths-killings.html (The New York Times)][https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/2023-10-07/ty-article-live/israel-under-attack-terrorists-infiltrate-from-gaza-amid-massive-rocket-barrages/0000018b-088b-dae9-adcb-abbff50f0000 (Haaretz)]

Israeli [[major general]] [[Nimrod Aloni (general)|Nimrod Aloni]], commander of the [[Depth Corps]], is [[prisoner of war|captured]] by Hamas. Scores of Israeli and non-Israeli [[civilian]]s are taken [[hostage]] to Gaza. Hamas spokesman [[Abu Obaida (Hamas)|Abu Obaida]] says they are being held in "safe places and resistance tunnels".  [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/israel-palestine-hamas-war-hostage-b2425961.html (''The Independent'')] [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2023/10/07/israel-palestine-war-commander-captured-by-hamas/ (''The Telegraph'')]

[[Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades]] commander [[Mohammed Deif]] announces the invasion as the start of [[Operation Al-Aqsa Flood]]. Israel [[Declaration of war|declares a state of war]] in response and warns Palestinian civilians to leave the Gaza Strip. [https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-gaza-hamas-rockets-airstrikes-tel-aviv-11fb98655c256d54ecb5329284fc37d2 (AP)]

Thousands of Israelis are injured by [[missile]] attacks and shootings, and at least 700 are killed. At least 400 [[Palestinians]] are killed and over 1,600 are injured in the Gaza Strip by [[airstrike]]s launched by the [[Israeli Air Force]]. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/10/7/israel-palestine-escalation-live-news-barrage-of-rockets-fired-from-gaza (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/over-100-killed-in-hamas-onslaught-on-southern-israel/ (The Times of Israel)]

[[Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades|Hamas forces]] and the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]] clash for a second day in [[Sderot]]. [https://www.voanews.com/a/israel-hamas-battle-for-second-day-after-surprise-hamas-attack-/7301582.html (VOA)]

Pro-[[Israel]] and pro-[[State of Palestine|Palestine]] rallies occur in several [[United States|American]] cities, including [[Atlanta]], [[Chicago]] and [[New York City|New York]].  [https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-gaza-hamas-demonstrations-d5f00f49f9b967c3148a39c8b7ffec08 (AP)]

[[Hezbollah]] forces in southern [[Lebanon]] open fire on Israeli positions in [[Shebaa Farms]] with [[artillery]] and [[Missile guidance|guided rockets]]. Israel responds with [[airstrike]]s on Hezbollah artillery positions. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/8/israel-hezbollah-exchange-fire-raising-regional-tensions (Al Jazeera)]

More than 260 bodies are found in [[Re'im]], [[Southern District (Israel)|Southern Israel]], after [[Hamas]] attacked a [[trance music|trance]] [[music festival]]. Foreign nationals are among those killed in the [[massacre]]. [https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-67047034 (BBC News)]

Israel's [[Security Cabinet of Israel|Security Cabinet]] says that it has approved a [[military operation]] against Hamas and [[Palestinian Islamic Jihad]] in the [[Gaza Strip]]. [https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/security-cabinet-says-israel-will-destroy-military-governmental-abilities-of-hamas-islamic-jihad/ (Times of Israel)]

The death toll in the Gaza Strip increases to 370 with more than 2,200 injured. The death toll in Israel increases to more than 750 with over 2,000 injured. Hamas says they hold 130 Israeli captives. [https://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/defense/1696737000-liveblog-israeli-toll-from-hamas-attacks-at-over-250-dead-1-600-wounded/ (i24 News)] [https://www.barrons.com/news/gaza-death-toll-in-war-with-israel-rises-to-370-ministry-6e6f36d4 (AFP via ''Barron's'')]

Israeli [[List of ambassadors of Israel to the United States|ambassador to the United States]] [[Michael Herzog (ambassador)|Michael Herzog]] says that [[Americans]] have been taken [[hostage]] by Hamas in Gaza. [https://www.politico.com/news/2023/10/08/americans-hostages-hamas-israel-00120521 (Politico)]

Israel launches [[airstrike]]s on the [[Al-Shati camp|Al-Shati]] [[refugee camp]] in the Gaza Strip, resulting in [[civilian]] casualties. [https://edition.cnn.com/videos/world/2023/10/09/gaza-al-shati-refugee-camp-israel-airstrike-cnc-vpx.cnn (CNN)]

Pro-[[State of Palestine|Palestine]] and pro-[[Israel]] [[2023 Israel–Hamas war protests|protests]] are held in [[London]], [[United Kingdom]], with pro-Palestinian protesters also gathering at the [[Embassy of Israel, London|Israeli Embassy]]. [https://www.thenationalnews.com/world/uk-news/2023/10/09/londoners-rally-in-support-of-israel-and-palestine-revealing-deep-divisions/ (''The National News'')] [https://www.aa.com.tr/en/middle-east/pro-palestine-protesters-gather-in-front-of-israeli-embassy-in-london/3013519 (AA)]

The [[United Nations Security Council]] meets in an emergency session but fails to achieve unanimity for a joint statement. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/9/un-security-council-meets-on-gaza-israel-but-fails-to-agree-on-statement (Al Jazeera)]

Israel launches airstrikes on a market in the [[Jabalia Camp]] in the [[Gaza Strip]], killing more than 60 civilians and injuring 120 others. [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/10/09/world/middleeast/israel-gaza-market-air-strike-jabaliya.html (''The New York Times'')]

Israel announces a total [[blockade]] of the Gaza Strip, encompassing supplies of food, water, electricity, and gas. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/10/9/israel-announces-total-blockade-on-gaza (Al Jazeera)]

Israeli air attacks and [[Shell (projectile)|shelling]] targeting houses and apartment buildings displace over 123,000 people in Gaza, according to the [[United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs|UN Office for Humanitarian Affairs]]. [https://english.news.cn/20231010/b0d921577b114eaa8049b61ed89b24ed/c.html (Xinhua)]

At least 22 members of a Palestinian family, including seven children, are killed in an Israeli air strike in [[Khan Younis]], [[Gaza Strip]]. Six members of the family remain trapped under the rubble of the destroyed house. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/10/8/israel-palestine-escalation-live-israeli-forces-bombard-gaza (Al Jazeera)]

The death toll from the Israeli airstrikes in the Gaza Strip increases to 687 people, with more than 3,800 injured. The death toll in Israel increases to 900 with more than 2,500 injured. [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/10/9/israel-hamas-war-live-news-israel-orders-complete-siege-of-gaza-strip (Al Jazeera)] [https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-death-toll-in-gaza-war-said-to-climb-to-800/ (''Times of Israel'')]

Four [[Hezbollah]] members are killed in an Israeli airstrike in [[Ayta ash Shab]], [[Lebanon]], while two others are killed during a [[shootout]] on [[Blue Line (withdrawal line)|the border]] with Israel. [https://www.dawn.com/news/1780234/hezbollah-fires-on-israel-after-four-members-killed-in-shelling (Dawn)]

In [[Beita, Nablus]], a Palestinian is shot by [[Israel Defense Forces|Israeli soldiers]].
